meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>ultra</kanji> or <kanji>super</kanji> so the verb version is what happens when you do something ultra or super much. You start <vocabulary>to exceed</vocabulary> the amount you were meant to do it. If you ultra drive a car, you exceed the speed limit. If you ultra study, you exceed your brain capacity. Get it?
readingMnemonic: Who likes <vocabulary>to exceed</vocabulary> everything? Your <reading>子</reading> (こ)! Or you, when you were a 子. No bedtimes, parents, or other limitations could stop you! You were able to go over them all!
